# Scale

# Scale ⇐ MusicalPattern

Represents a musical scale - a series of pitch classes following a specific pattern from a root(the tonic) which forms chords and can be used to compose melodies.

Kind: global class
Extends: MusicalPattern

  • Scale ⇐ MusicalPattern
    • new exports.Scale(tonic, name, pattern)
    • .chords : Array
    • .seventhChords : Array
    • .degree(degree) ⇒ PitchClass
    • .chord(degree, [size]) ⇒ *

# new exports.Scale(tonic, name, pattern)

Param Type
tonic String/Note
name
pattern Array

Example

const c = new PitchClass('c')
const C_Major_by_pattern = new Scale(c, [0, 2, 4, 5, 7, 9, 11]) // new C major scale.

# scale.chords : Array

Returns an array of chords(triads) where each member is the chord at the degree where 0 is the root chord.

Kind: instance property of Scale

# scale.seventhChords : Array

Returns an array of chords(seventh) where each member is the chord at the degree where 0 is the root chord.

Kind: instance property of Scale

# scale.degree(degree) ⇒ PitchClass

Returns the degree inside the Scale. for example - if the Scale is a C Major, than interval(1) will return D.

Kind: instance method of Scale

Param Type
degree Number

# scale.chord(degree, [size]) ⇒ *

Returns the chord at the degree with size.

Kind: instance method of Scale

Param Type Default Description
degree number Degree to get chord at.
[size] number 3 Number of pitch classes in the chord.
